lead_paragraph: The art dealer Larry Gagosian and the Qatar royal family are disputing the ownership of a Picasso sculpture of his mistress, Marie-Thérèse, on view at MoMA.

byline.contributor: Doreen Carvajal contributed reporting from Paris.

snippet: The art dealer Larry Gagosian and the Qatar royal family are disputing the ownership of a Picasso sculpture of his mistress, Marie-Thérèse, on view at MoMA.

headline.main: Picasso Bust at Center of Custody Battle Between Gagosian and Qatar Royal Family
headline.print_headline: Picasso Bust Sells for Millions, but Did It Go to Two Buyers?

abstract: Art dealer Larry Gagosian and royal family of Qatar both claim to have purchased Picasso's plaster bust of his muse Marie-Therese Walter, prompting lawsuit and questions over whether Picasso's daughter Maya Widmaier-Picasso sold bust to two buyers; case is complicated by competitive and secretive nature of art world and complex nature of Picasso's family.
